description: If n = Product (p_j^k_j) then a(n) = Product ( prime(k_j)^pi(p_j) ) where pi is A000720.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: A048767 := proc(n)    local a,p,e,f;    a := 1 ;    for f in ifactors(n)[2] do        p := op(1,f) ;        e := op(2,f) ;        a := a*ithprime(e)^numtheory[pi](p) ;    end do:    a ;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 08 2012
author: _Naohiro Nomoto_
extensions: a(1)=1 prepended by _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 26 2015
